metadata.title: CVE-2012-3449 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Open vSwitch 1.4.2 uses world writable permissions for (1)/var/lib/openvswitch/pki/controllerca/incoming/ and (2)/var/lib/openvswitch/pki/switchca/incoming/, which allows local users todelete and overwrite arbitrary files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3449` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-ipsec - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-pki - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-switch - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-test - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-testcontroller - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-vtep - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
python-openvswitch - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3').
